p:
The third time series regression model was constructed using standardized meteorological data. Mean and standard deviation were calculated for each climatic variable from January 2012 to November 2015 and the climatic variables standardized. Then, stepwise regression model selection was performed with logarithm transformed dengue incidences versus retrospective standardized meteorological variables and logarithm transformed dengue incidences to identify significant variables. In the model, significant variables were rainfall and rainy days lagged 3 months, minimum RH lagged 2 months, and squared dengue cases lagged 1 month. Therefore, our regression equation for the model was:
3
